thread.title: Sony Pikachu with 21MP camera and Android Nougat spotted on GFXBench
thread.title_full: Sony Pikachu with 21MP camera and Android Nougat spotted on GFXBench

title: Sony Pikachu with 21MP camera and Android Nougat spotted on GFXBench
text:
Sony Pikachu with 21MP camera and Android Nougat spotted on GFXBench Sony Pikachu with 21MP camera and Android Nougat spotted on GFXBench By - February 14, 2017 “Sony’s upcoming smartphone with a 5-inch HD display, octa-core SoC and 3GB RAM has been spotted” 
A new Sony smartphone has been spotted on GFXBench with the codename Pikachu. As per the listing, the smartphone will run Android Nougat out-of-the-box and will pack in a 21-megapixel primary shooter. 
The GFXBench listing reveals that the Sony Pikachu will feature a 5-inch HD display, and will be powered by a 2.3GHz octa-core MediaTek MT6757 processor, mated to 3GB of RAM. The storage capacity on board will be 32GB, which will probably be further expandable via a microSD card. Other specs mentioned on the benchmarking site include an 8MP selfie shooter, full HD video recording support and NFC. 
There’s no word on when Sony plans to launch the Pikachu smartphone. The company will reportedly be unveiling the Xperia Z5 Premium’s successor later this month at MWC, so we expect the Pikachu to be introduced there as well.
